disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Tuesday 19 April to end of Tuesday 19 April GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Further settled weather for Tuesday, albeit with more cloud cover and lower temperatures than of late.<br/><br/>For most of the day, an Atlantic breeze will introduce relatively 'clean' air into Greater London. However, some imported particulate pollution is expected from late afternoon as a change in wind direction draws in air that has passed over industrialized areas around the border of France and Belgium. This late import is not though expected to raise particulate pollution levels (which are calculated as a daily average) above the 'Low' banding. <br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Wednesday 20 April to end of Wednesday 20 April GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: A strengthening north-easterly breeze will be a feature of Wednesday's weather. <br/><br/>Although this air flow has the potential to bring in particulates from northern Germany and Holland, a marked import of long-range pollution is not expected. This is because the air is forecast to travel quickly and at relatively high altitude over Europe, thereby limiting the en route accumulation of pollutants.     <br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>
